entry.title: Please support this families
entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Please support this families

Sanctuary4All Colorado

Happy #GivingTuesday! Sanctuary4All is an immigrant-led group dedicated to protecting families and improving the lives of Colorado immigrants of all backgrounds.... Founded in 2019 by longtime immigration activist Jeanette Vizguerra, Sanctuary4All works at the intersection of mutual aid and political action. By connecting directly impacted families with caring members of our community we will lift each other up and build a movement to affect positive systemic change for the masses. You can support our mission by purchasing pupusas from Yessenia at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co committing to a monthly donation via Patreon at Patreon.com/Sanctuary4All or donating to sanctuary-4-all on Venmo. ðŸ’•âœ¨

See More

Founded in 2019 by longtime immigration activist Jeanette Vizguerra, Sanctuary4All works at the intersection of mutual aid and political action. By connecting directly impacted families with caring members of our community we will lift each other up and build a movement to affect positive systemic change for the masses. entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

We are asking for the support of the community, since the solidarity meals are to support each immigrant family in the sanctuary, this time it was the turn of the Blanco MartÃ­nez family since the covid situation has reduced Carlos Blanco's hours in the restaurant that works and will be making pupusas for the rent since the covid has affected many families, that is why this program has been created. share please

entry.title: Today weâ€™re thankful for your support of the Solidarity Meals...
entry.content:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is with Carlo Blanco and 2 others in Denver, Colorado.

Today weâ€™re thankful for your support of the Solidarity Meals program since we launched it last May. Pictured here are Yessenia, Carlos, and Jeanette making turkey dinners, pozole, and punch. Many of these meals were distributed to unhoused folks in Denver today, and were incredibly grateful to the people who partnered with us to make that possible. While Thanksgiving is still taught in schools as a celebration of the help that Native American tribes offered white settlers, we know that this is a whitewashed retelling of the genocide against Indigenous people, violence that continues today. You can check the link in our bio for a zine from @seedingsovereignty about Indigenous resistance and ways to support. Solidarity with our Indigenous siblings today and every day.
